resources.string: URL has automatically been filled in
Why does \"ReviewCheck\" need permissions for internet?\nInternet permissions are required to get the adjusted reviews and the detailed information to your phone.
Why is there no information available for certain products?\nThat happens when a product is new or hasn\'t been analyzed yet. This should be done shortly when having the full review open.

ReviewCheck itself doesn't store personal any data on any other device than your current device.
The data that's stored on this device is only your Search history, which you can delete if you wish so.
We also use the ReviewMeta API where we get the adjusted reviews. In part of the request we only send the product's ASIN which is only for the specific product.
Anyway we recommend to check out the privacy policy which ReviewMeta.com has.
https://reviewmeta.com/blog/privacy/

ReviewCheck does NOT get developed, funded or sponsored by ReviewMeta in any way.
ReviewCheck is just using the public ReviewMeta API.

ReviewCheck is not affiliated with any vendor, manifacturer or platform which are shown in this app.

There is no right that the information shown in this app is correctly shown.

ReviewCheck is developed and poperty of Project Whitespace. The logo and code is property by ProjectWhitespace but made open-source under "Mozilla Public License 2.0".
The source code can be seen on this GitHub Repository.
https://github.com/MrMinemeet/ReviewCheck
https://www.ProjectWhitespace.net
ReviewMeta is property of Review Honesty Inc.. The Logo and the information shown corrisponds to the legal owner. https://reviewmeta.com/
